entry.value: import knime.scripting.io as knio%%00010import matplotlib.pyplot as plt%%00010%%00010# Daten laden%%00010df = knio.input_tables[0].to_pandas()%%00010%%00010# Metriken extrahieren (ohne NaN)%%00010metrics = []%%00010values = []%%00010colors = []%%00010%%00010color_map = {%%00010 'mean absolute error': ('#2196F3', 'MAE'),%%00010 'mean squared error': ('#4CAF50', 'MSE'),%%00010 'root mean squared error': ('#FF9800', 'RMSE'),%%00010 'mean signed difference': ('#9C27B0', 'MSD')%%00010}%%00010%%00010for idx, row in df.iterrows():%%00010 metric_name = row['Metrik']%%00010 metric_value = row['prediction']%%00010 %%00010 # NaN Ã¼berspringen%%00010 if pd.isna(metric_value):%%00010 continue%%00010 %%00010 # Suche nach Mapping%%00010 for key, (color, short_name) in color_map.items():%%00010 if key in metric_name.lower():%%00010 metrics.append(short_name)%%00010 values.append(float(metric_value))%%00010 colors.append(color)%%00010 break%%00010%%00010# Plot%%00010fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))%%00010%%00010bars = ax.barh(metrics, values, color=colors, alpha=0.8, edgecolor='black', linewidth=2)%%00010%%00010# Werte%%00010for bar, value in zip(bars, values):%%00010 width = bar.get_width()%%00010 ax.text(width + max(values)*0.02, bar.get_y() + bar.get_height()/2,%%00010 f'{value:.4f}',%%00010 ha='left', va='center', fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')%%00010%%00010ax.set_xlabel('Fehler-Wert', fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')%%00010ax.set_title('Fehlermetriken', fontsize=16, fontweight='bold')%%00010ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3, axis='x')%%00010ax.invert_yaxis()%%00010%%00010plt.tight_layout()%%00010knio.output_view = knio.view(fig)
